arm_group.description: The whole body vibration group received 3 training sessions every week composed of 5 series of 15 seconds of vibrations at 30 Hz intensity.
The control group had a normal daily life for the whole study period

brief_summary.textblock:
Tiredness, lack of motivation and low compliance can be observed in nursing home residents
      during the practice of physical activity. Because exercises should not be too vigorous,
      whole body vibration could potentially be an effective alternative.

      The objective of this randomized controlled trial is to assess the impact of 3-month
      training by whole body vibration on the risk of falls among nursing home residents.

      Patients were randomized into two groups: the whole body vibration group which received 3
      training sessions every week composed of 5 series of only 15 seconds of vibrations at 30 Hz
      intensity and a control group with normal daily life for the whole study period.

      The impact of this training on the risk of falls was assessed blindly by three tests: the
      Tinetti Test, the Timed Up and Go test and a quantitative evaluation of a 10-second walk
      performed with a tri-axial accelerometer.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of 3 Months of Controlled Whole Body Vibrations on the Risk of Falls Among Nursing Home Residents

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Resident of nursing home

          -  Able to move

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  weighing more than 150 kg

          -  having electronic implants (e.g. pacemaker, brain stimulators)

          -  having prosthetic hips or knees

          -  suffering from epilepsy, bleeding disorders, inflammatory abdominal disorders or at
             high risk of thromboembolism.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of 3 Months of Controlled Whole Body Vibrations With Low Exposure Period on the Risk of Falls Among Nursing Home Residents

overall_official.affiliation: University Of Liège, Department of Public Health, Epidemiology and Health Economics, Liège, Belgiulm

primary_outcome.description: Tinetti test < 19 points = high risk of falls

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: A timed Up and Go > 14 seconds = high risk of falls
secondary_outcome.measure: Risk of fall evaluated by the Timed up and Go test
Risk of falls evaluated by the Locometrix

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
